    "iucat_barcode": "",
    "mods": "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>\n<modsCollection xmlns:xsi=\"http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance\" xmlns=\"http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3\" xsi:schemaLocation=\"http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3 http://www.loc.gov/standards/mods/v3/mods-3-7.xsd\">\n  <mods version=\"3.7\">\n    <titleInfo>\n      <title>Victor Bockris papers, 1960-2002 (bulk 1977-2002)</title>\n    </titleInfo>\n    <name type=\"personal\" usage=\"primary\">\n      <namePart>Bockris, Victor,</namePart>\n      <namePart type=\"date\">1949-</namePart>\n    </name>\n    <typeOfResource collection=\"yes\" manuscript=\"yes\">mixed material</typeOfResource>\n    <genre authority=\"aat\">Audiotapes.</genre>\n    <genre authority=\"aat\">Correspondence.</genre>\n    <genre authority=\"aat\">Diaries.</genre>\n    <genre authority=\"aat\">Drafts (documents)</genre>\n    <genre authority=\"aat\">Interviews.</genre>\n    <genre authority=\"aat\">Manuscripts.</genre>\n    <genre authority=\"aat\">Manuscripts for publication.</genre>\n    <genre authority=\"aat\">Clippings (information artifacts)</genre>\n    <genre authority=\"aat\">Photographs.</genre>\n    <genre authority=\"aat\">Videotapes.</genre>\n    <originInfo>\n      <place>\n        <placeTerm type=\"code\" authority=\"marccountry\">miu</placeTerm>\n      </place>\n      <dateIssued encoding=\"marc\" point=\"start\">1960</dateIssued>\n      <dateIssued encoding=\"marc\" point=\"end\">2002</dateIssued>\n      <issuance>monographic</issuance>\n    </originInfo>\n    <language>\n      <languageTerm authority=\"iso639-2b\" type=\"code\">eng</languageTerm>\n    </language>\n    <physicalDescription>\n      <extent unit=\"linear feet.\">44</extent>\n      <note type=\"arrangement\">The collection is divided into 19 series: Correspondence; Notebooks and Journals; Topical Files; Events; Muhammad Ali; Beat Punks (aka NYC Babylon); Blondie/Debbie Harry; Bebe Buell; William Burroughs; John Cale; Lou Reed; Keith Richards; Patti Smith; Terry Southern; Velvet Underground; Andy Warhol; Proposals and Drafts; Photographs; and Audiovisual.</note>\n    </physicalDescription>\n    <abstract displayLabel=\"Summary\">Papers include: correspondence with artists, musicians, poets, and other cultural figures of the New York post-Beat and Punk scene, including many letters from author, agent, and publisher, Andrew Wylie; personal and professional notebooks and journals; extensive drafts and manuscripts of Bockris' books; and original audiocassette tapes of interviews, some transcribed interviews can be found in the Transcripts series. The Lou Reed series comprises the largest group of papers, offering a complete timeline and the relevant documentary resources that formed the book Transformer: the Complete Lou Reed Story (Simon &amp; Schuster, 1994).</abstract>\n    <note type=\"biographical/historical\">Author, biographer, poet, and photographer Victor Bockris' works include over ten biographical works focusing on a variety of cultural icons, many of whom were active in the Beat and Punk movements. He was referred to as \u201cThe Poet Laureate of the New York Underground\u201d in his Beat Punks book published in 2000 (Ashby, 2002). In addition to these full length books, Bockris was also an active poet, interviewer, and wrote extensively for a variety of magazines including Andy Warhol's Interview, High Times, and Gadfly.</note>\n    <note>Included in the collection, but cataloged separately are inscribed copies of Bockris' books, in the original English and in foreign-language translations.</note>\n    <note>Unpublished finding aid available in the repository.</note>\n    <subject authority=\"lcsh\">\n      <name type=\"personal\">\n        <namePart>Ali, Muhammad,</namePart>\n        <namePart type=\"date\">1942-2016</namePart>\n      </name>\n    </subject>\n    <subject authority=\"lcsh\">\n      <name type=\"personal\">\n        <namePart>Buell, Bebe.</namePart>\n      </name>\n
